methods.description: Cancels the application cache download process. This method is intended to be used by Web applications showing their own caching progress UI, in case the user wants to stop the update (e.g., because bandwidth is limited).
methods.name: abort

methods.description: Switches to the most recent application cache, if there is a newer one. If there isn't, throws an '''InvalidStateError''' exception. This does not cause previously-loaded resources to be reloaded; for example, images do not suddenly get reloaded and style sheets and scripts do not get reparsed or reevaluated. The only change is that subsequent requests for cached resources will obtain the newer copies. The '''updateready''' event will fire before this method can be called. Once it fires, the Web application can, at its leisure, call this method to switch the underlying cache to the one with the more recent updates. To make proper use of this, applications have to be able to bring the new features into play; for example, reloading scripts to enable new features. An easier alternative to swapCache() is just to reload the entire page at a time suitable for the user, using location.reload().
methods.name: swapCache

methods.description: Invokes the application cache download process. Throws an InvalidStateError exception if there is no application cache to update. Calling this method is not usually necessary, as user agents will generally take care of updating application caches automatically. The method can be useful in situations such as long-lived applications. For example, a Web mail application might stay open in a browser tab for weeks at a time. Such an application could want to test for updates each day.
methods.name: update

methods.description: Returns the AudioTrack object with the given identifier, or null if no track has that identifier.
methods.name: getTrackById

methods.description: Adds the given cue to textTrack's text track list of cues.
methods.name: addCue

methods.description: Removes the given cue from textTrack's text track list of cues.
methods.name: removeCue

methods.description: Returns the text track cue text as a DocumentFragment of HTML elements and other DOM nodes.
methods.name: getCueAsHTML

methods.description: Returns the first text track cue (in text track cue order) with text track cue identifier ''id''. Returns null if none of the cues have the given identifier or if the argument is the empty string.
methods.name: getCueById

methods.description: Returns the time for the end of the range with the given index. Throws an IndexSizeError if the index is out of range.
methods.name: end

methods.description: Returns the time for the start of the range with the given index. Throws an IndexSizeError if the index is out of range.
methods.name: start

methods.description: Adds a new stop to a gradient. If ''offset'' is less than 0 or greater than 1 then an IndexSizeError exception must be thrown. If the color cannot be parsed as a CSS <color> value, then a SyntaxError exception must be thrown. Otherwise the gradient must have a new stop placed, at offset ''offset'' relative to the whole gradient, and with the color obtained by parsing ''color'' as a CSS <color> value.
methods.name: addColorStop

methods.description: Creates a hit region.
methods.name: addHitRegion

methods.description: Draws the specified arc.
methods.name: arc

methods.description: Check to be sure there's a subpath for (x1, y1). Then, the behavior depends on the arguments and the last point in the subpath. See Notes.
methods.name: arcTo

methods.description: Empties the list of subpaths in the context's current default path so that it once again has zero subpaths.
methods.name: beginPath

methods.description: Ensures there is a subpath for ''(cp1x, cp1y)'', then connects the last point in the subpath to the given point ''(x, y)'' using a cubic BÃ©zier curve with control points ''(cp1x, cp1y)'' and ''(cp2x, cp2y)'', then adds the point ''(x, y)'' to the subpath.
methods.name: bezierCurveTo

methods.description: Clears all pixels on the canvas in the given rectangle ''(x, y, w, h)'' to transparent black.
methods.name: clearRect

methods.description: Specifies a new clipping region by calculating the intersection of the current clipping region and the area described by the intended path, using the non-zero winding number rule. The new clipping region replaces the current clipping region.
methods.name: clip

methods.description: Marks the last subpath as closed, creates a new subpath whose first point is the same as the previous subpath's first point, and then adds the new subpath to the path. If the object's path has no subpaths, this method does nothing.
methods.name: closePath

methods.description: Depending on how it is called, returns either an '''ImageData''' object with the given ''sw, sh'' dimensions or an '''ImageData''' object with the same dimensions as the ''imagedata'' argument. See Notes.
methods.name: createImageData

methods.description: Returns a linear '''CanvasGradient''' initialized with the specified line as represented by the start point (''x0, y0'') and end point (''x1, y1'') of the gradient.
methods.name: createLinearGradient

methods.description: Returns a '''CanvasPattern''' object that uses the given ''image'' and repeats in the direction(s) given by the ''repetition'' argument.
methods.name: createPattern

methods.description: Returns a radial '''CanvasGradient''' initialized with the two specified circles. This effectively creates a cone, touched by the two circles defined in the creation of the gradient, with the part of the cone before the start circle (0.0) using the color of the first offset, the part of the cone after the end circle (1.0) using the color of the last offset, and areas outside the cone (untouched by the gradient) transparent black.
methods.name: createRadialGradient

methods.description: Draw a focus ring of the appropriate style along the intended path, and sets result to ''false''.
methods.name: drawCustomFocusRing

methods.description: Draws the specified image onto the canvas. Can be called in three ways; see Notes.
methods.name: drawImage

methods.description: Draws a focus ring of the appropriate style along the intended path, following platform conventions.
methods.name: drawSystemFocusRing

methods.description: Draws the specified ellipse. If the object's path has any subpaths, this method adds a straight line from the last point in the subpath to the start point of the arc. Then, it adds the start and end points of the arc to the subpath, and connects them with an arc.
methods.name: ellipse

methods.description: Fills all the subpaths of the intended path, using ''fillStyle'', and using the non-zero winding number rule. Open subpaths must be implicitly closed when being filled (without affecting the actual subpaths).
methods.name: fill

methods.description: Paints the specified rectangular area using the color (or style) defined by ''[[apis/canvas/CanvasRenderingContext2D/fillStyle|fillStyle]]''.
methods.name: fillRect

methods.description: Renders the given text at the given (x, y) coordinates, ensuring that the text isn't wider than maxWidth (if specified), using the current font, textAlign, and textBaseline values.
methods.name: fillText

methods.description: Returns an ImageData object representing the underlying pixel data for the area of the canvas denoted by the rectangle whose corners are the four points (sx, sy), (sx+sw, sy), (sx+sw, sy+sh), (sx, sy+sh), in canvas coordinate space units.
methods.name: getImageData

methods.description: Gets the line dash properties for the stroke.
methods.name: getLineDash

methods.description: Returns true if the point given by the x and y coordinates passed to the method, when treated as coordinates in the canvas coordinate space unaffected by the current transformation, is inside the intended path as determined by the non-zero winding number rule; returns false otherwise.  If either of the arguments is infinite or NaN, then the method returns false.
methods.name: isPointInPath

methods.description: Connects the last point in the subpath to the given point (x, y) using a straight line, and then adds the point to the subpath.
methods.name: lineTo

methods.description: Creates a new subpath with the specified point as its first (and only) point.
methods.name: moveTo

methods.description: Writes data from ImageData structures back to the canvas. If any of the arguments are infinite or NaN, the method must throw a NotSupportedError exception. When the last four arguments are omitted, they are assumed to have the values 0, 0, the width member of the imagedata structure, and the height member of the imagedata structure, respectively.
methods.name: putImageData

methods.description: Ensures there is a subpath for (cpx, cpy), then connects the last point in the subpath to the given point (x, y) using a quadratic BÃ©zier curve with control point (cpx, cpy), and then adds the given point (x, y) to the subpath.
methods.name: quadraticCurveTo

methods.description: Creates a new subpath containing just the four points (x, y), (x+w, y), (x+w, y+h), (x, y+h), with those four points connected by straight lines, then marks the subpath as closed. It then creates a new subpath with the point (x, y) as the only point in the subpath.
methods.name: rect

methods.description: Removes a previously-defined hit region.
methods.name: removeHitRegion

methods.description: Pops the top entry from the drawing state stack, and reset the drawing state it describes. If there is no saved state, the method does nothing.
methods.name: restore

methods.description: Addd the rotation transformation described by the argument to the transformation matrix. The ''angle'' argument represents a clockwise rotation angle expressed in radians.
methods.name: rotate

methods.description: Saves the current state of the context. Use the restore() method to retrieve the saved state.
methods.name: save

methods.description: Adds the scaling transformation described by the arguments to the transformation matrix. The ''x'' argument represents the scale factor in the horizontal direction; the ''y'' argument represents the scale factor in the vertical direction. The factors are multiples.
methods.name: scale

methods.description: Scrolls the current path into view. See Notes.
methods.name: scrollPathIntoView

methods.description: Sets the line dash properties for the stroke.
methods.name: setLineDash

methods.description: Resets the current transform to the identity matrix, and then invokes the ''transform(a, b, c, d, e, f)'' method with the same arguments.
methods.name: setTransform

methods.description: Traces the intended path, using the CanvasRenderingContext2D object for the line styles, and then fills the combined stroke area using the strokeStyle attribute.
methods.name: stroke

methods.description: Takes the result of tracing the path, using the CanvasRenderingContext2D object's line styles, and fills it with the strokeStyle.
methods.name: strokeRect

methods.description: Renders the given text at the given (x, y) coordinates, ensuring that the text isn't wider than maxWidth (if specified), using the current font, textAlign, and textBaseline values.
methods.name: strokeText

methods.description:
Replaces the current transformation matrix with the result of multiplying the current transformation matrix with the matrix described by: a c e
b d f
0 0 1
methods.name: transform

methods.description: Modifies the transformation matrix of this context by adding the scaling transformation described by the arguments to the transformation matrix. The arguments represent the scale factors in the horizontal (''x'') and vertical (''y'') directions. The factors are multiples.
methods.name: translate

methods.description: Returns a TextMetrics object that contains the width of the specified text.
methods.name: measureText

methods.description: Returns a collection of nodes representing the flow's source content.
methods.name: getContent

methods.description: Returns the series of regions into which content flows.
methods.name: getRegions

methods.description: Returns the series of regions that contain at least part of the supplied target content element.
methods.name: getRegionsByContent

methods.description: Returns styles calculated for an element as it appears within a region, including styles from [[css/atrules/@region|'''@region''']] rules applied to ranges within the element.
methods.name: getComputedRegionStyle

methods.description: Returns a series of [[dom/apis/range|'''Range''']] objects that represent the fragments of DOM content that currently flow into the region.
methods.name: getRegionFlowRanges

methods.description: Releases the file lock for the associated file resource or frees the memory for the Blob object. After calling this method, performing addition operations on the Blob object fails and throws an exception.
methods.name: close

methods.description: Returns a new Blob object with bytes ranging from its optional start parameter up to but not including its optional end parameter.
methods.name: slice

methods.description: '''item''' returns the ''index''th File object in the FileList. If there is no ''index''th File object in the FileList, then this method must return null.
methods.name: item

methods.description: Aborts a read operation.
methods.name: abort

methods.description: Returns partial Blob data representing the number of bytes currently loaded (as a fraction of the total), as an ArrayBuffer object.
methods.name: readAsArrayBuffer

methods.description: Returns the complete data of blob as a Data URL.
methods.name: readAsDataURL

methods.description: Returns partial Blob data representing the number of bytes currently loaded (as a fraction of the total), decoded into memory according to the encoding determination.
methods.name: readAsText

methods.description: Performs an asynchronous read of an [[apis/file/MSStream|MSStream]] object in order to create a [[apis/file/Blob|Blob]] object.
methods.name: readAsBlob

methods.description: Returns partial Blob data representing the number of bytes currently loaded (as a fraction of the total), decoded into memory according to the encoding determination.
methods.name: readAsText

methods.description: Creates a URL for the specified object.
methods.name: createObjectURL

methods.description: Revokes a URL from a document and frees the object associated with that URL.
methods.name: revokeObjectURL

methods.description: Creates a new DirectoryReader to read Entries from this Directory.
methods.name: createReader

methods.description: Creates or looks up a directory.
methods.name: getDirectory

methods.description: Creates or looks up a file.
methods.name: getFile

methods.description: Deletes a directory and all of its contents, if any. In the event of an error [e.g. trying to delete a directory that contains a file that cannot be removed], some of the contents of the directory may be deleted. It is an error to attempt to delete the root directory of a filesystem.
methods.name: removeRecursively

methods.description: Creates a new DirectoryReaderSync to read EntrySyncs from this DirectorySync.
methods.name: createReader

methods.description: Creates or looks up a directory.
methods.name: getDirectory

methods.description: Creates or looks up a file.
methods.name: getFile

methods.description: Deletes a directory and all of its contents, if any. In the event of an error [e.g. trying to delete a directory that contains a file that cannot be removed], some of the contents of the directory may be deleted. It is an error to attempt to delete the root directory of a filesystem.
methods.name: removeRecursively

methods.description: Read the next block of entries from this directory.
methods.name: readEntries

methods.description: Read the next block of entries from this directory.
methods.name: readEntries

methods.description: Used to supply an array of Entries as a response to a user query.
methods.name: handleEvent

methods.description: Copy an Entry to a different location on the file system.
methods.name: copyTo

methods.description: Look up metadata about this Entry.
methods.name: getMetadata

methods.description: Look up the parent DirectoryEntry containing this Entry. If this Entry is the root of its filesystem, its parent is itself.
methods.name: getParent

methods.description: Move an Entry to a different location on the file system.
methods.name: moveTo

methods.description: Deletes a file or directory.
methods.name: remove

methods.description: Returns a URL that can be used to identify this Entry.
methods.name: toURL

methods.description: Used to supply an Entry as a response to a user query.
methods.name: handleEvent

methods.description: Copy an EntrySync to a different location on the file system.
methods.name: copyTo

methods.description: Look up metadata about this EntrySync.
methods.name: getMetadata

methods.description: Look up the parent DirectoryEntrySync containing this EntrySync. If this EntrySync is the root of its filesystem, its parent is itself.
methods.name: getParent

methods.description: Move an EntrySync to a different location on the file system.
methods.name: moveTo

methods.description: Deletes a file or directory.
methods.name: remove

methods.description: Returns a URL that can be used to identify this EntrySync.
methods.name: toURL

methods.description: There was an error with the request. Details are provided by the err parameter.
methods.name: handleEvent

methods.description: Used to supply a File as a response to a user query.
methods.name: handleEvent

methods.description: Creates a new FileWriter associated with the file that this FileEntry represents.
methods.name: createWriter

methods.description: Returns a File that represents the current state of the file that this FileEntry represents.
methods.name: file

methods.description: Creates a new FileWriterSync associated with the file that this FileEntrySync represents.
methods.name: createWriter

methods.description: Returns a File that represents the current state of the file that this FileEntrySync represents.
methods.name: file

methods.description: The file system was successfully obtained.
methods.name: handleEvent

methods.description: Used to supply a FileWriter as a response to a user query.
methods.name: handleEvent

methods.description: Requests a file system where data should be stored. You access a sandboxed file system by requesting a LocalFileSystem object using this global method, window.requestFileSystem().
methods.name: requestFileSystem

methods.description: Allows the user to look up the Entry for a file or directory referred to by a local URL.
methods.name: resolveLocalFileSystemURL

methods.description: Requests a file system where data should be stored. You access a sandboxed file system by requesting a LocalFileSystemSync object from within a web worker using this global method, window.requestFileSystemSync().
methods.name: requestFileSystemSync

methods.description: Allows the user to look up the Entry for a file or directory referred to by a local URL.
methods.name: resolveLocalFileSystemSyncURL

methods.description: Used to supply file or directory metadata as a response to a user query.
methods.name: handleEvent

methods.description: Indicates success of an asynchronous method.
methods.name: handleEvent

methods.description: Stops a specific watch process.
methods.name: clearWatch

methods.description: Obtains the current location of the device.
methods.name: getCurrentPosition

methods.description: Returns a long value that uniquely identifies a watch operation and then asynchronously starts the watch operation.
methods.name: watchPosition

methods.description: Advances the cursor by the specified number.
methods.name: advance

methods.description: Moves to the next record (or the record specified by a key).
methods.name: continue

methods.description: Returns an IDBRequest object and, in a separate thread, deletes the record at the cursor's position, without changing the cursor's position. Once the record is deleted, the cursor's value is set to null.
methods.name: delete

methods.description: Creates a structured clone of the value parameter.
methods.name: update

methods.description: This method synchronously performs the steps for closing a database connection and returns once the database has been closed.
methods.name: close

methods.description: The createObjectStore method enables you to create object stores inside an indexedDB database. The creation of an object store is only possible inside an "versionchange" transaction.
methods.name: createObjectStore

methods.description: Destroys an object store with the given name as well as all indexes that are referencing that object store.
methods.name: deleteObjectStore

methods.description: Deletion candidate. Not in spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/
methods.name: setVersion

methods.description: Execute the steps for creating a transaction in a sychronous fashion.
methods.name: transaction

methods.description:
The method compares two specified keys. 
The method returns 1 if the first key is greater than the second, -1 if the first is less than the second, and 0 if the first is equal to the second.
methods.name: cmp

methods.description: Deletes a database with the specified name
methods.name: deleteDatabase

methods.description: The open method is used to open an IndexedDB database.
methods.name: open

methods.description: Runs the steps for asynchronously executing a request and returns the IDBRequest created by these steps.
methods.name: count

methods.description: Runs the steps for asynchronously executing a request and returns the IDBRequest created by these steps.
methods.name: get

methods.description: Creates a cursor.
methods.name: openCursor

methods.description: Creates a cursor.
methods.name: openKeyCursor

methods.description: Creates and returns a new key range with lower set to lower, lowerOpen set to lowerOpen, upper set to upper and upperOpen set to upperOpen.
methods.name: bound

methods.description: Creates and returns a new key range with lower set to lower, lowerOpen set to open, upper set to undefined and and upperOpen set to true.
methods.name: lowerBound

methods.description: Creates and returns a new key range with both lower and upper set to value and both lowerOpen and upperOpen set to false.
methods.name: only

methods.description: Creates and returns a new key range with lower set to undefined, lowerOpen set to true, upper set to upper and and upperOpen set to open.
methods.name: upperBound

methods.description: Adds a record to the specified object store.
methods.name: add

methods.description: Removes all records from the object store.
methods.name: clear

methods.description: The count method returns the number of records in an object store.
methods.name: count

methods.description: This method creates and returns a new index with the given name and parameters in the connected database.
methods.name: createIndex

methods.description: Removes a record from the specified Object Store.
methods.name: delete

methods.description: This method destroys the index with the given name in the connected database. Note that this method must only be called from a "versionchange" transaction callback.
methods.name: deleteIndex

methods.description: Runs the steps for asynchronously executing a request and returns the IDBRequest created by these steps.
methods.name: get

methods.description: Returns an IDBIndex representing an index that is part of the object store.
methods.name: index

methods.description: Creates a cursor.
methods.name: openCursor

methods.description: Creates a structured clone of the value parameter.
methods.name: put

methods.description: The abort method is used to abort a transaction. Once called, the abort method follows the [http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/#dfn-steps-for-aborting-a-transaction steps to abort] a transaction
methods.name: abort

methods.description: Returns an object store that has already been added to the scope of this transaction.
methods.name: objectStore

methods.description: Opens a database. See [[apis/indexeddb/IDBFactory/open]]
methods.name: open

methods.description: Parse a JSON string to a JavaScript object.
methods.name: parse

methods.description: Export a JavaScript object to a JSON string.
methods.name: stringify

methods.description: Navigate to a new page.
methods.name: assign

methods.description: Refresh/reload the current page, optionally forcing a re-download of the content.
methods.name: reload

methods.description: Similar to [[apis/location/assign|window.location.assign]], except that it "replaces" the current document, removing the previous one from the back button history.
methods.name: replace

methods.description: Queries the current usage (how much data is stored) and quota available for the requesting application.
methods.name: queryUsageAndQuota

methods.description: Requests a new quota for the requesting application.
methods.name: requestQuota

methods.description: Clears the buffer used to store the current list of PerformanceResourceTiming resources.
methods.name: clearResourceTimings

methods.description: Sets the maximum number of PerformanceResourceTiming resources that may be stored in the buffer to the value of the maxSize parameter.
methods.name: setResourceTimingBufferSize

methods.description: A method to invoke at the optimal time a callback to update the frame of an animation
methods.name: requestAnimationFrame

methods.description: Removes all DOMHighResTimeStamp time values for the given mark name, or removes all marks and their associated DOMHighResTimeStamp time values.
methods.name: clearMarks

methods.description: Removes all DOMHighResTimeStamp durations for the given measure name, or removes all measures and their associated DOMHighResTimeStamp durations.
methods.name: clearMeasures

methods.description: Stores a timestamp with the associated name (a "mark").
methods.name: mark

methods.description: Stores the DOMHighResTimeStamp duration between two marks along with the associated name (a "measure").
methods.name: measure

methods.description: Disconnects the port, so that it is no longer active.
methods.name: close

methods.description: Posts a message through the channel, from one port to the other.
methods.name: postMessage

methods.description: Begins dispatching messages received on the port.
methods.name: start

methods.description: Causes the list associated with the object to be emptied of all key/value pairs, if there are any.
methods.name: clear

methods.description: Returns the current value associated with the given key.
methods.name: getItem

methods.description: Returns the name of the ''n''th key in the list.
methods.name: key

methods.description: Removes the key/value pair with the given key from the list associated with the object, if it exists.
methods.name: removeItem

methods.description: Adds or replaces a value for the given key.
methods.name: setItem

methods.description: Copies the current frequency data into the passed unsigned byte array. If the array has fewer elements than the [[apis/webaudio/AnalyserNode/frequencyBinCount|'''frequencyBinCount''']], the excess elements will be dropped.
methods.name: getByteFrequencyData

methods.description: Copies the current time-domain (waveform) data into the passed unsigned byte array. If the array has fewer elements than the [[apis/webaudio/AnalyserNode/frequencyBinCount|'''frequencyBinCount''']], the excess elements will be dropped.
methods.name: getByteTimeDomainData

methods.description: Copies the current frequency data into the passed floating-point array. If the array has fewer elements than the [[apis/webaudio/AnalyserNode/frequencyBinCount|'''frequencyBinCount''']], the excess elements will be dropped.
methods.name: getFloatFrequencyData

methods.description: Returns the '''Float32Array''' representing the PCM audio data for the specific channel.
methods.name: getChannelData

methods.description: Schedules a sound to playback at an exact time.
methods.name: start

methods.description: Schedules a sound to stop playback at an exact time.
methods.name: stop

methods.description: Creates an [[apis/webaudio/AnalyserNode|'''AnalyserNode''']].
methods.name: createAnalyser

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/BiquadFilterNode|'''BiquadFilterNode''']] representing a second order filter which can be configured as one of several common filter types.
methods.name: createBiquadFilter

methods.description: Creates an [[apis/webaudio/AudioBuffer|'''AudioBuffer''']] of the given size. The audio data in the buffer will be zero-initialized (silent). An exception will be thrown if the [[apis/webaudio/AudioBuffer/numberOfChannels|'''numberOfChannels''']] or [[apis/webaudio/AudioContext/sampleRate|'''sampleRate''']] are out-of-bounds.
methods.name: createBuffer

methods.description: Creates an [[apis/webaudio/AudioBufferSourceNode|'''AudioBufferSourceNode''']].
methods.name: createBufferSource

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/ChannelMergerNode|'''ChannelMergerNode''']] representing a channel merger. An exception will be thrown for invalid parameter values.
methods.name: createChannelMerger

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/ChannelSplitterNode|'''ChannelSplitterNode''']] representing a channel splitter. An exception will be thrown for invalid parameter values.
methods.name: createChannelSplitter

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/ConvolverNode|'''ConvolverNode''']].
methods.name: createConvolver

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/DelayNode|'''DelayNode''']] representing a variable delay line. The initial default delay time will be 0 seconds.
methods.name: createDelay

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/DynamicsCompressorNode|'''DynamicsCompressorNode''']].
methods.name: createDynamicsCompressor

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/GainNode|'''GainNode''']].
methods.name: createGain

methods.description: Creates a '''MediaElementAudioSourceNode''' given an [[dom/HTMLMediaElement|'''HTMLMediaElement''']]. As a consequence of calling this method, audio playback from the [[dom/HTMLMediaElement|'''HTMLMediaElement''']] will be re-routed into the processing graph of the [[apis/webaudio/AudioContext|'''AudioContext''']].
methods.name: createMediaElementSource

methods.description: Creates a '''MediaStreamAudioSourceNode''' given a [[apis/webrtc/MediaStream|'''MediaStream''']]. As a consequence of calling this method, audio playback from the [[apis/webrtc/MediaStream|'''MediaStream''']] will be re-routed into the processing graph of the [[apis/webaudio/AudioContext|'''AudioContext''']].
methods.name: createMediaStreamSource

methods.description: Creates an [[apis/webaudio/OscillatorNode|'''OscillatorNode''']].
methods.name: createOscillator

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/PannerNode|'''PannerNode''']].
methods.name: createPanner

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/ScriptProcessorNode|'''ScriptProcessorNode''']] for direct audio processing using JavaScript. An exception will be thrown if [[apis/webaudio/ScriptProcessorNode/bufferSize|'''bufferSize''']] or '''numberOfInputChannels''' or '''numberOfOutputChannels''' are outside the valid range.
methods.name: createScriptProcessor

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/WaveShaperNode|'''WaveShaperNode''']] representing a non-linear distortion.
methods.name: createWaveShaper

methods.description: Creates a [[apis/webaudio/WaveTable|'''WaveTable''']] representing a waveform containing arbitrary harmonic content. The real and imag parameters must be of type '''Float32Array''' of equal lengths greater than zero and less than or equal to 4096 or an exception will be thrown. These parameters specify the Fourier coefficients of a Fourier series representing the partials of a periodic waveform. The created [[apis/webaudio/WaveTable|'''WaveTable''']] will be used with an [[apis/webaudio/OscillatorNode|'''OscillatorNode''']] and will represent a normalized time-domain waveform having maximum absolute peak value of 1. Another way of saying this is that the generated waveform of an [[apis/webaudio/OscillatorNode|'''OscillatorNode''']] will have maximum peak value at 0dBFS. Conveniently, this corresponds to the full-range of the signal values used by the Web Audio API. Because the [[apis/webaudio/WaveTable|'''WaveTable''']] will be normalized on creation, the real and imag parameters represent relative values.
methods.name: createWaveTable

methods.description:
Asynchronously decodes the audio file data contained in the [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/JavaScript_typed_arrays/ArrayBuffer '''ArrayBuffer''']. The ArrayBuffer can, for example, be loaded from an XMLHttpRequest with the new '''responseType''' and '''response''' attributes. Audio file data can be in any of the formats supported by the audio element.

The [[apis/webaudio/AudioContext/decodeAudioData|'''decodeAudioData()''']] method is preferred over the [[apis/webaudio/AudioContext/createBuffer|'''createBuffer()''']] from ArrayBuffer method because it is asynchronous and does not block the main JavaScript thread.
methods.name: decodeAudioData

methods.description: Describes which direction the listener is pointing in the 3D cartesian coordinate space. Both a front vector and an up vector are provided. In simple human terms, the front vector represents which direction the person's nose is pointing. The up vector represents the direction the top of a person's head is pointing. These values are expected to be linearly independent (at right angles to each other). The x, y, z parameters represent a front direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being (0,0,-1). The xUp, yUp, zUp parameters represent an up direction vector in 3D space, with the default value being (0,1,0).
methods.name: setOrientation

methods.description: Sets the position of the listener in a 3D cartesian coordinate space. [[apis/webaudio/PannerNode|'''PannerNode''']] objects use this position relative to individual audio sources for spatialization. The x, y, z parameters represent the coordinates in 3D space. The default value is (0,0,0).
methods.name: setPosition

methods.description: Sets the velocity vector of the listener. This vector controls both the direction of travel and the speed in 3D space. This velocity relative an audio source's velocity is used to determine how much doppler shift (pitch change) to apply. The x, y, z parameters describe a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity. The default value is (0,0,0).
methods.name: setVelocity

methods.description: Connects the [[apis/webaudio/AudioNode|'''AudioNode''']] to another [[apis/webaudio/AudioNode|'''AudioNode''']].
methods.name: connect

methods.description: Disconnects an [[apis/webaudio/AudioNode|'''AudioNode''']]'s output.
methods.name: disconnect

methods.description: Cancels all scheduled parameter changes with times greater than or equal to '''startTime'''.
methods.name: cancelScheduledValues

methods.description: Schedules an exponential continuous change in parameter value from the previous scheduled parameter value to the given value. Parameters representing filter frequencies and playback rate are best changed exponentially because of the way humans perceive sound.
methods.name: exponentialRampToValueAtTime

methods.description: Schedules a linear continuous change in parameter value from the previous scheduled parameter value to the given value.
methods.name: linearRampToValueAtTime

methods.description: Start exponentially approaching the target value at the given time with a rate having the given time constant. Among other uses, this is useful for implementing the ''decay'' and ''release'' portions of an ADSR envelope. Please note that the parameter value does not immediately change to the target value at the given time, but instead gradually changes to the target value.
methods.name: setTargetAtTime

methods.description: Schedules a parameter value change at the given time.
methods.name: setValueAtTime

methods.description: Sets an array of arbitrary parameter values starting at the given time for the given duration. The number of values will be scaled to fit into the desired duration.
methods.name: setValueCurveAtTime

methods.description: Given the current filter parameter settings, calculates the frequency response for the specified frequencies.
methods.name: getFrequencyResponse

methods.description: Sets an arbitrary custom periodic waveform given a [[apis/webaudio/WaveTable|'''WaveTable''']].
methods.name: setWaveTable

methods.description: Schedules a sound to playback at an exact time.
methods.name: start

methods.description: Schedules a sound to stop playback at an exact time.
methods.name: stop

methods.description: Describes which direction the audio source is pointing in the 3D cartesian coordinate space. Depending on how directional the sound is (controlled by the cone attributes), a sound pointing away from the listener can be very quiet or completely silent. The x, y, and z parameters represent a direction vector in 3D space. The default value is (1,0,0).
methods.name: setOrientation

methods.description: Sets the position of the audio source relative to the listener attribute. A 3D cartesian coordinate system is used. The x, y, and z parameters represent the coordinates in 3D space. The default value is (0,0,0).
methods.name: setPosition

methods.description: Sets the velocity vector of the audio source. This vector controls both the direction of travel and the speed in 3D space. This velocity relative to the listener's velocity is used to determine how much doppler shift (pitch change) to apply. The x, y, and z parameters describe a direction vector indicating direction of travel and intensity. The default value is (0,0,0).
methods.name: setVelocity

methods.description: Permanently halts the generation of data for the tracks' sources and removes the references to the sources.
methods.name: stop

methods.description: Adds a MediaStreamTrack to this track list.
methods.name: add

methods.description: Returns the MediaStreamTrack at the specified index value.
methods.name: item

methods.description: Removes a MediaStreamTrack from this track list.

methods.description: Closes the RTCDataChannel.

methods.description: Sends a message (''data'') on the RTCDataChannelâs underlying data transport.

methods.description: Adds a new stream to the RTCPeerConnection.

methods.description: Creates an [[apis/webrtc/RTCDataChannel|RTCDataChannel]] object with the given label.

methods.description: Creates a session description compatible with the local configuration.

methods.description: Provides an identity assertion.

methods.description: Retrieves status information for a given [[apis/webrtc/MediaStreamTrack|MediaStreamTrack]].

methods.description: Removes the given stream from the [[apis/webrtc/RTCPeerConnection/localStreams|localStreams]] array in the RTCPeerConnection and fires the [[apis/webrtc/RTCPeerConnection/negotiationneeded|negotiationneeded]] event.

methods.description: Sets the identity provider. Not required if the browser is already configured for an identity provider.

methods.description: Immediately terminates the worker with which the object is associated.
methods.name: terminate

methods.description: Discards any pending tasks and immediately closes the worker.

methods.description: Fetches one or more script resources, identified by absolute URLs.

methods.description: Stops an asynchronous XMLHttpRequest in progress.

methods.description: Returns all the response headers as a string, or null if no response has been received.

methods.description: Overrides the MIME type returned by the server.

methods.description: Initiates the request defined by the XMLHttpRequest.

methods.description: Sets the value of an XMLHttpRequest header.

methods.description: Adds a medium to the end of the current list. If the medium is already used, it is first removed.

methods.description: Gets the priority of a property in a CSS style declaration.

methods.description: Gets the value of a property in a CSS style declaration.

methods.description: Removes a property from a CSS style declaration.

methods.description: Sets a property, value and priority within a CSS style declaration.

methods.description: Not implemented anywhere. Non standard.

methods.description: Creates a style sheet for the document.

methods.description: Gets the final used values of all the CSS properties of an element. The returned object is of the same type that the object returned from the element's [[css/cssom/style|"style"]] property, however the two objects have different purposes. The object returned from getComputedStyle is read-only and can be used to inspect the element's style (including those set by a <style> element or an external stylesheet). The elt.style object should be used to set styles on a specific element.
methods.name: getComputedStyle

methods.description: Non standard. Indicates whether a property is enabled.

methods.description: Non standard. Sets a property as enabled or disabled.
methods.name: msPutPropertyEnabled

methods.description: Non standard. Obsolete. Recalculates all dynamic CSS expressions in the current document.

methods.description: Non standard. Adds an @import rule to the style sheet.

methods.description: Deletes a CSS rule from the style sheet.

methods.description: Adds a new CSS rule to the stylesheet.
methods.name: insertRule

methods.description: Non standard. Removes an @import rule from the style sheet.

methods.description: Non standard. Removes a rule from a style sheet.

methods.description: Indicates whether the document currently matches a media query.

methods.description: Unfocuses the selected element, if it is focused.

methods.description: document.getElementById returns the element with a given ID property from the document. It's one of the primary ways to get access to DOM objects in JavaScript.

methods.description: Gathers [[apis/css-regions/NamedFlow|'''NamedFlow''']] objects, each representing a set of content that flows through various layout regions.

methods.description: Not implemented. Non standard.
methods.name: AutoScan

methods.description: Non standard. Proprietary. Shows a color selection dialog and retrieves the chosen color.

methods.description: Adds an [[html/elements/option|option]] element to the [[html/elements/select|select]] element.
methods.name: add

methods.description: Registers an event handler for the specified event type.
methods.name: addEventListener

methods.description: Tries to move a node from one document to the document that the '''document''' object displays.
methods.name: adoptNode

methods.description: Not recommended, synchronized, annoys users and causes user interface issues. Displays a dialog box showing the given text and a localized OK button.

methods.description: Appends an element as a child to the object.

methods.description: Adds a new character string to the end of the object.

methods.description: Non standard. Use [[dom/methods/appendChild|appendChild]], [[dom/methods/insertBefore|insertBefore]], or other algorithms instead. Makes an element be the child of a given element, or makes the given element a child of the element, moving its children to be the children of the given element.
methods.name: applyElement

methods.description: Loads a new document from a given URL.
methods.name: assign

methods.description: Non standard. Use [[dom/methods/addEventListener|addEventListener]] instead. Binds the specified function to an event, so that the function gets called whenever the event fires on the object.
methods.name: attachEvent

methods.description: Removes one or more data formats from the clipboard through the '''dataTransfer''' object or the [[dom/clipboardData|'''clipboardData''']] object.

methods.description: Covers what the click action is and what happens when it is performed.

methods.description: Closes an output stream and forces the sent data to display.

methods.description: Compares the position of two nodes in a document.

methods.description: Not recommended, synchronized, annoys users and causes user interface issues. Displays a confirmation dialog box showing the given text and possibly localized OK and Cancel buttons.

methods.description: Creates an [[dom/attributes|'''attribute''']] objectÂ with a specified [[html/attributes/name|'''name''']].

methods.description: Creates a '''comment''' objectÂ with the specified [[html/attributes/data|'''data''']].

methods.description: Creates a Document Type node.
methods.name: createDocumentType

methods.description: Creates an instance of the element for the specified tag.
methods.name: createElement

methods.description: Creates an element from the specified namespace.
methods.name: createElementNS

methods.description: Creates a DOM event of the specified type.
methods.name: createEvent

methods.description: Non standard. Use [[dom/methods/createEvent|'''createEvent''']] instead. Generates an '''event''' object to pass event context information when you use the [[dom/methods/fireEvent|'''fireEvent''']] method.
methods.name: createEventObject

methods.description: Creates an HTML document.
methods.name: createHTMLDocument

methods.description: Non standard. Proprietary. Do not use. Create a regular element instead. Creates an overlay window within the browser window.

methods.description: Non standard. Use [[dom/methods/removeEventListener|removeEventListener]] instead. Unbinds the specified function from the event, so that the function stops receiving notifications when the event fires.
methods.name: detachEvent

methods.description: Sends an event to the current element.
methods.name: dispatchEvent

methods.description: Non standard. Proprietary. Use [[dom/properties/draggable|draggable]] instead. Allows an element to particitipate in a drag and drop procedure.
methods.name: dragDrop

methods.description: Returns the element for the specified x coordinate and the specified y coordinate.
methods.name: elementFromPoint

methods.description: Non standard. Executes a given scripting code.
methods.name: execScript

methods.description: The exitFullscreen method provides a way for exiting the fullscreen mode enabled by [[dom/methods/requestFullscreen|requestFullscreen]].
methods.name: exitFullscreen

methods.description: Non standard. Proprietary. Use [[dom/methods/dispatchEvent|dispatchEvent]] instead. Fires a specified event on the object.
methods.name: fireEvent

methods.description: Non standard. Gets a text from a given location around the edges of the element.
methods.name: getAdjacentText

methods.description: Returns the value of the content attribute.
methods.name: getAttribute

methods.description: Non standard. Obsolete. Do not use.
methods.name: getAttribute (userProfile)

methods.description: Retrieves an attribute node by name.
methods.name: getAttributeNode

methods.description: Gets an [[dom/attributes|'''attribute''']] object that matches the specified namespace and name.
methods.name: getAttributeNodeNS

methods.description:
Returns a ClientRect object that encloses a group of text rectangles. 
The returned value is a ClientRect object which is the union of the rectangles returned by getClientRects() for the element, i.e., the CSS border-boxes associated with the element. It contains read-only left, top, right and bottom properties describing the border-box, in pixels, with the top-left relative to the top-left of the viewport.
methods.name: getBoundingClientRect

methods.description: The returned value is a collection of [[cssom/ClientRect|ClientRect]] objects, one for each CSS border box associated with the element. Each ClientRect object contains read-only left, top, right and bottom properties describing the border box, in pixels, with the top-left relative to the top-left of the viewport. For tables with captions, the caption is included even though it's outside the border box of the table.
methods.name: getClientRects

methods.description: Gets the data in the specified format from the clipboard through the '''dataTransfer''' object or the [[dom/clipboardData|'''clipboardData''']] object.
methods.name: getData

methods.description: Gets an element with a specified ID.
methods.name: getElementById

methods.description: Use [[css/selectors_api/querySelectorAll|elementOrDocument.querySelectorAll(".class-name.other-class-name")]] instead. Gets a collection of all descendant elements with given classes.
methods.name: getElementsByClassName

methods.description: Gets a list of elements with a specified name attribute value.
methods.name: getElementsByName

methods.description: Gets a collection of all descendant elements with a given name.
methods.name: getElementsByTagName

methods.description: Retrieves a snapshot of the data for the currently connected and interacted-with gamepads. Returns a [[apis/gamepad/Gamepad|Gamepad]] object.

methods.description: Queries the state of the specified modifier key.

methods.description: Gets an attribute with a given name from an element.

methods.description: Gets an attribute with a given name and a given namespace.

methods.description: Navigates to a relatively positioned history record.
